body_html:
Just to note, I ran into this as well. From memory both GradientDescent and AdamOptimizer worked happily but AdagradOptimizer threw errors. Thinking it was related to the single lookup issue @vincentvanhoucke mentioned and assumed it was expected behaviour.

@shaileshahuja - whilst not equivalent, a temporary helper would be to use AdamOptimizer as it will give you many of the adaptive learning rate advantages of AdagradOptimizer.
body_text:
Just to note, I ran into this as well. From memory both GradientDescent and AdamOptimizer worked happily but AdagradOptimizer threw errors. Thinking it was related to the single lookup issue @vincentvanhoucke mentioned and assumed it was expected behaviour.
@shaileshahuja - whilst not equivalent, a temporary helper would be to use AdamOptimizer as it will give you many of the adaptive learning rate advantages of AdagradOptimizer.
body:
Just to note, I ran into this as well. From memory both `GradientDescent` and `AdamOptimizer` worked happily but `AdagradOptimizer` threw errors. Thinking it was related to the single lookup issue @vincentvanhoucke mentioned and assumed it was expected behaviour.

@shaileshahuja - whilst not equivalent, a temporary helper would be to use `AdamOptimizer` as it will give you many of the adaptive learning rate advantages of `AdagradOptimizer`.
